title: Ticket #7874: Late materialization jobs that fail SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS abort schedd
description:
The schedd can have an ASSERT failure (exit with status 4) if users submit multiple late materialization job clusters that are disallowed due to SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS. This bug was introduced in v8.9.3 in commit [57491]. The schedd log file will have errors looking like this: 

   10/02/20 16:29:32 Calling Timer handler 16 (JobMaterializeTimerCallback)
   10/02/20 16:29:32 Trying to Materializing new job 88.0 step=0 row=0
   10/02/20 16:29:32 Trying to Materializing new job 88.1 step=1 row=0
   10/02/20 16:29:32 CommitTransaction() failed for cluster 88 rval=-1 ( ... )
   10/02/20 16:29:32 Trying to Materializing new job 89.0 step=0 row=0
   10/02/20 16:29:32 ERROR "Assertion ERROR on (! JobQueue->InTransaction())" at line 5207 in file C:\Users\tannenba\condor\CONDOR_SRC_THREE\src\condor_schedd.V6\qmgmt.cpp
check_ins:
2020-Oct-05 10:14   Check-in [61422]: version history for #7783 and #7792 and #7874 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2020-Oct-05 09:44   Check-in [61418]: version history for #7874, #7668 and #7670 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2020-Oct-02 18:08   Check-in [61410]: Fix schedd ASSERT when late materialize jobs are refused. #7874 The schedd can have an ASSERT failure (exit with status 4) if users submit multiple late materialization job clusters that are disallowed due to SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS. This is because the code failed to abort transactions that failed the submit_requirements [...] (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: tannenba
